get.summary: Get Custom Field / Folder By Id
get.description:
Get Custom Field / Folder By Id.

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

put.description:
Update Custom Field By Id

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

delete.description:
Delete Custom Field By Id

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

get.summary: Get Custom Fields By Object Key
get.description:
Get Custom Fields By Object Key

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

parameters.name: objectKey
parameters.description: key of the Object. Must include "custom_objects." prefix for custom objects. Available on the Custom Objects details Page under settings

post.description:
Create Custom Field Folder

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

put.description:
Create Custom Field Folder

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

delete.description:
Create Custom Field Folder

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

post.description:
Create Custom Field

! Only supports Custom Objects and Company (Business) today. Will be extended to other Standard Objects in the future.

info.title: CUSTOM_FIELDS API
info.description: Custom fields are data points that allow you to capture and store specific information tailored to your business requirements. You can create fields across field types like text, numeric, selection options and special fields like date/time or signature

tags.name: CUSTOM_FIELDS
tags.description: Custom fields are data points that allow you to capture and store specific information tailored to your business requirements. You can create fields across field types like text, numeric, selection options and special fields like date/time or signature

bearer.name: Authorization
bearer.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account (OR) Private Integration Token of Sub-Account.

Location-Access.name: Authorization
Location-Access.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Sub-Account (OR) Private Integration Token of Sub-Account.

Agency-Access.name: Authorization
Agency-Access.description: Use the Access Token generated with user type as Agency (OR) Private Integration Token of Agency.

message.example: Invalid token: access token is invalid

key.description: Key of the option (Included in Create and Response, excluded in Update)

url.description: URL associated with the option (Optional, valid only for RADIO type)

showInForms.description: Whether the field should be shown in forms

options.description: Options for the field (Optional, valid only for SINGLE_OPTIONS, MULTIPLE_OPTIONS, RADIO, CHECKBOX, TEXTBOX_LIST type)

acceptedFormats.description: Allowed file formats for uploads. Options include: .pdf, .docx, .doc, .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .csv, .xlsx, .xls, all

objectKey.description: The key for your custom / standard object. This key uniquely identifies the custom object. Example: "custom_object.pet" for a custom object related to pets.

dataType.description: Type of field that you are trying to create

fieldKey.description: Field key. For Custom Object it's formatted as "custom_object.{objectKey}.{fieldKey}". "custom_object" is a fixed prefix, "{objectKey}" is your custom object's identifier, and "{fieldName}" is the unique field name within that object. Example: "custom_object.pet.name" for a "name" field in a "pet" custom object.

allowCustomOption.description: Determines if users can add a custom option value different from the predefined options in records for RADIO type fields. A custom value added in one record does not automatically become an option and will not appear as an option for other records.

dateAdded.description: Date and time when the object was added

dateUpdated.description: Date and time when the object was last updated

folders.description: Custom Fields folder for the object.

showInForms.description: Whether the field should be shown in forms

options.description: Options for the field (Optional, valid only for SINGLE_OPTIONS, MULTIPLE_OPTIONS, RADIO, CHECKBOX, TEXTBOX_LIST type)

acceptedFormats.description: Allowed file formats for uploads. Options include: .pdf, .docx, .doc, .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .csv, .xlsx, .xls, all

dataType.description: Type of field that you are trying to create

fieldKey.description: Field key. For Custom Object it's formatted as "custom_object.{objectKey}.{fieldKey}". "custom_object" is a fixed prefix, "{objectKey}" is your custom object's identifier, and "{fieldKey}" is the unique field name within that object. Example: "custom_object.pet.name" for a "name" field in a "pet" custom object.

objectKey.description: The key for your custom object. This key uniquely identifies the custom object. Example: "custom_object.pet" for a custom object related to pets.

maxFileLimit.description: Maximum file limit for uploads. Applicable only for fields with a data type of FILE_UPLOAD.

allowCustomOption.description: Determines if users can add a custom option value different from the predefined options in records for RADIO type fields. A custom value added in one record does not automatically become an option and will not appear as an option for other records.

objectKey.description: The key for your custom object. This key uniquely identifies the custom object. Example: "custom_object.pet" for a custom object related to pets.
The key for your custom object. This key uniquely identifies the custom object. Example: "custom_object.pet" for a custom object related to pets.

showInForms.description: Whether the field should be shown in forms

options.description: Options for the field. Important: Providing options will completely replace the existing options array. You must include all existing options alongside any new options you wish to add. Removal of options is not supported through this update. Applicable only for SINGLE_OPTIONS, MULTIPLE_OPTIONS, RADIO, CHECKBOX, TEXTBOX_LIST types.

acceptedFormats.description: Allowed file formats for uploads. Options include: .pdf, .docx, .doc, .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .csv, .xlsx, .xls, all

maxFileLimit.description: Maximum file limit for uploads. Applicable only for fields with a data type of FILE_UPLOAD.
